by IreneBelserion69, Jun 2, 2019, 1:50:18 PM

Personal Journal

(Due to the internet outage Wednesday, this journal was delayed by several days, this was originally intended to come out before Endgame to address the problems of making Captain Marvel Thanos level both in the comics and within the MCU itself, this would likely be outdated as this update is being written with the release of Endgame, sorry for the inconvenience caused by the internet outage. Inevitably due to inevitable shitty writing, i half expect Captain Marvel to defeat Thanos singlehandedly with no real effort and further piss on the grave of the MCU and look forward to hating the hell out of Endgame, boy that would be fun!

Update: Updated the size of the Universe and revised allUniverse calcs due to new numbers in preparation for the Kirby respect thread soon.

Also redid calcs that used the 1×10^12 muplticaion now that i learned how to do those right, fixed all mathematical errors, will be updating DBZ too

UPDATE: Updated the size of the Muitiverse based on the Muitverse forumala)

Because you haven’t gotten sick of me bashing Captain Marvel and i love putting this egotistical cunt in her place, we’re going to cover yet another journal on her, this would be my last one on her until the end of Endgame. I’m working on doing a separate journal entirely on her performance on Endgame and look forward to hating every second of her on screen and hating the movie for her ruining it but let’s put this bullshit to rest that she’s the Strongest Avenger in any continuity be it the Marvel Cinematic Universe or in the Comics.

Much like my “How Strong is Luffy Debunked Journal”, I’ll be using calcs from other sites like VS Battle Wiki, Reddit, Comic Vine and other sites along with making up my own calcs based on presented feats from the movies and comics. Unlike my how strong is Luffy Journal, there is no joy to be had other than putting this cunt in her fucking place and debunking the bullshit narrative pimped out by Marvel that she’s the strongest Marvel/Avenger’s character because let’s be real, she’s honestly fun to hate.

www.marvel.com/articles/comics…

I briefly covered this bulllshit Social Justice infographic in Part 3 of my Anti Captain Marvel reviews which i basically said all this.

www.fandom.com/articles/captai…

Whereas Marvel going by this fourm here literally is stated to have up 418,000,000,000,000 joules or a measly 99.904 Kilotons of TNT

While much of the above is speculative when it comes to how things will play out in Avengers: Endgame, we do know that Captain Marvel is pretty much unbeatable when it comes to hand-to-hand combat. As well as being super strong, super durable, immune to toxins and possessing the ability to fly, she can also emit really powerful photon blasts from her body. In Captain Marvel, we see her slice a spaceship in two, and that Marvel infographic tells us she gives out 418,000,000,000,000 joules in one energy blast. Compared with Black Panther’s 37,500.

99 Kilotons look like this on the map.

So yes going by the Marvel Infographic trying to wank Captain Marvel, she only has 99.04 Kilotons of TNT. Not to shabby right, after all the MCU is far weaker than the comics and having Town level attack potency isn’t too shabby.

Thor’s feat of busting Skovoda

vsbattles.fandom.com/wiki/User…

There is actually an exact value in the movie. FRIDAY says Sokovia’s diametre is 6410 feet/1953.768 m.

Original calc.

First, volume of Sokovia. Assuming it’s a hemisphere, like Gwynbleiddd did so, then multiply by the density, 2800, we get the mass.

So according to Gwynbleiddd’s scaling, the debris travelled at 532 px/s.

Sokovia is 1143 px, so the debris is (532/1143*1953.768).

(2/3*pi*1953.768^3*2800)*((532/1143*1953.768)^2)*0.5 = 1.8083496816778625961e+19, just barely Island level

EDIT: A better image of the Sokovia’s diametreForgot to divide the diametre in two. That should be 976.884 m.

All values taken to 2 decimals cuz I’m lazy.

However, analyzing on watchframebyframe, it took around 0.93 seconds, not 1 full second. The speed is:

(532/1143*1953.768)/0.93 = 977.81

Mass:

2/3*pi*976.884^3*2800 = 5.47e12

5.47e+12*977.81^2*0.5 = 2.61e+18 Joules, just barely Mountain level+

Not bad, he can fight Cole.

So Thor going by this feat is 4.322 Gigatons of TNT which is Large Mountain level+. This would make Thor going by this feat over 43,740 times more powerful than MCU Captain Marvel going by Marvel’s own Infographic, most powerful Avenger my fucking ass.

Then you have this fight from Surtur

Introduction

This is actually a redux of an old calculation originally done by Darkanine all credit to pixel scaling and mass calculation goes to him.

An error in the math occurred, so I’ll fix that up real quick.

The Calculation

So the new calc still uses the same mass, but with a new timeframe and distance, resulting in new speed. The changes to the math are simple.

885 divided into 135 is not 68.07, it is 6.556. So this will be an entire magnitude downgrade.

6.556*1414.356 = 9272.518 meters.

2:49.98-2:50.67 = 0.69 seconds

Speed: 13438.432 m/s

Argard: 2.7551033×10^13 kg, as found by Darkanine

KE: 0.5*(2.7551033×10^13)*13438.432^2 = 2.4877406×10^21 joules, or 594.584 Gigatons of TNT, High 6-C, Large Island level+

Final Tally

Destroying Asgard: 2.4877406×10^21 joules, or 594.584 Gigatons of TNT, High 6-C, Large Island level+

The Hulk is easily on this level of power considering Thor feared the Hulk could kill Surtur and Hulk actually caused the behemoth to flinch. That would make both Post Skaar Hulk, Thor and Surtur all over 6 Million times more powerful than MCU Captain Marvel going by the Infographic. Yeah Marvel, you really suck at wanking your Mary Sue female lead.

Yeah not looking good for Captain Marvel and we haven’t even gotten to Thanos in the MCU.

The same Thor and Hulk effortlessly boiled by base Thanos who literally bodied both of them for the fun of it. Just how powerful is he with the finity gualent though.

Thanos Moonbusting attack potency

www.narutoforums.org/xfa-blog-…

3.06 seconds.

T = 3191.7km/3.06s

= 1043039.22/340.29

= Mach 3065.14802

Spiderman reacts to the meteorites and saves Mantis and Drax from them, so it scales to their reactions (and it’s consistent with Yondu exscaping Ego and Thor’s hammer reaching the Moon). Now, onto the energy to rip apart the moons surface and drag it down.

R = (h/2) + c^2/(8h)

= (13/2) + 295^2/(8 X 13)

= 843.278846

843.278846 X 2 = 1686.55769 pixels

1686.55769 pixels = 1123km

1 pixel = 1123km/1686.55769 = 0.665853298km

0.665853298km X 4 = 2.66341319km

1123km/2 = 561.5km (561500m)

561.5km – 2.66341319km = 558.836587km (558836.587m)

V = 4/3πr^3

= 4/3 X π X 558836.587^3

= 7.31043305e17m^3

V = 7.41545649e17 – 7.31043305e17

= 1.0502344e16m^3

It seems to be mainly the front side, so we’ll half that area.

V = 1.0502344e16/2

= 5.251172e15m^3

Violent fragmentation of rock is 69000000 joules/m^3.

E = 1.3826457e16 X 69000000

= 9.54025533e23 joules

We’ll add that on to the KE at the end.

M = 5.251172e15 X 1480

= 7.77173456e18kg

KE = (0.5) X 7.77173456e18 X 964259.819^2

= 3.61306773e30 joules

A friend point out in the fight, that not only was a continent ripped apart, but the entire moon itself.

2:48

So the entire moon was fragmented and thrown it seems. We’ll go with a high end of that in anycase.

V = 4/3πr^3

= 4/3 X π X 561500^3

= 7.41545649e17m^3

Violent fragmentation of rock is 69000000 joules/m^3.

E = 7.41545649e17 X 69000000

= 5.11666498e25 joules

Let’s also get the KE.

KE = (0.5) X 1.0e20 X 964259.819^2

= 4.64898499e31 joules

= 11.1113407983 zettatons

Final Results

Meteorites fall to Titan = 3065.148

Meteroite hits Iron Man = 2.126 gigatons

Thanos rips moons surface off (low end) = 863.544 exatons

Thanos rips moons surface off (high end) = 11.111 zettatons

So simply using a casual feat from the Infinity Gauntlet, Thanos is pretty much on a ridiculously far higher level than Captain Marvel. Thanos attack Potency is 11 Quadrillion Megatons of TNT, Captain Marvel is barely 1/10th a Megaton of TNT, that makes Captain Marvel over 110 Quadrillion times weaker than Thanos, that’s the difference in power.

And once again not even going by powerscaling to Ronan the Accuser who can desotry a whole planet and that’s merely weilding one of the stones.

vsbattles.fandom.com/wiki/User…

Ronan the Accuser literally wields an Orb that casually lifewiped a whole planet, a feat going by scaling is worth roughly 2.1863518e+37 joules, or 5.22550621415 ninatons (Large Planet level). To break this down in sheer numbers, that’s way stronger than Megaton level nukes. I know to go by how Captain Marvel is scaled in the comics, she’s much higher than merely Town level+ and I’m being a dick downplaying her but I’m not the one who put out infographics claiming she can beat Thanos yet have her qaunaitfably below Thanos by calcs even by MCU standards.

And that’s not even taking forth his massive feat in the Marvel Cinematic Universe.

Thanos Finger snaps the Universe.

So an average adult human has a volume around 75 l, or 75,000 cubic centimeters.

Human denisty:1.01 g/cc

At least I trillion Galaxies in our Universe.

MCU Thanos with the Infinity Gaulent snaps half the Universe:73.336 MegaFoe (Solar System +)

So yeah claiming Captain Marvel is on the same level as Thanos is utterly laughable and makes me cringe at the thought of the sudden rectons they’re going to do to make her so much stronger than she deserves to be.

Honestly, i would have zero problems accepting Captain Marvel being “Thanos level” if she was actually given a tough final boss, you know someone like Ronan the Accuser or a fucking Super Skrull, ANYTHING OTHER THAN HAVING HER STROKE HER EGO KILLING NOTHING BUT FODDER!

This is why it pays off to have an actual challenge for the hero, so we can see what the hero in question can do, we never get that once throughout Captain Marvel, she never fights a true challenge to her, just nothing but one-sided curbstomps.

“Oh, she beat a whole army” And? The Skrulls were pussies as well as the fucking Kree, fuck the Red Ribbon Army was more a threat than the Skurlls or Kree despite being far inferior technology wise. Goku could defeat the fucking Skrulls with ease as a Kid, am i supposed to be impressed by less impressive feats than Kid Goku?

Hell, i doubt she could even beat Staff Officer Black given her lack of any impressive feats. This is why it pays off to actually BUILD UP YOU FUCKING VILLAINS.

Going back to WonderWoman yet again, Daina fought against normal humans sure but the god Areas as shown to be a supernatural threat who pushed Wonder Woman to her Limits, we actually see her and how powerful she can be, generating storms and killing him with her power, this is something that’s built up lore-wise.

Captain Marvel, by contrast, has no fucking lore build up about her powers, no weight, nothing. Of course expect her to single-handedly beat Thanos via bad writing, contrived plot devices and having to nerf Hulk and Thor just to make her look good.

Now onto Captain Marvel in the comics, surely she is the most powerful Avenger in the comics, right?

As established before, she’s only consistently shown to be Solar System Level+ within the Comics at best. That’s only Base Thor level or base Hulk level. Even with her highest end feat which was absorbing a Blackhole, it’s still only Solar System level+, Thor and Hulk have shown far more impressive and much higher feats as Thor has occasionally battled High Skyfather to Low Celestial Tier characters while Hulk has battled Sentry and Doctor Strange who are casually above Solar System level.

Contrast this with a full power bloodlusted Thor who’s able to crack the Armor of Celestials, beings which are consistently depicted as extremely casual Universe Busters and superior to Skyfather tier and Cosmic Cube level characters.

And able to knock back a fully fed Galactus who can literally desotry entire Universes with ease.

Thor is also shown moving the mass of the entire World Tree which is depicted to have the mass of at least a Small Multiverse.

As each of the Nine Realms of the God Tree is depicted to be at least Universe Size each with their own dimensional spaces of time as well.

Essentially Thor’s full power is easily comparable to Zeno from Dragon Ball, easily in the Low Multiverse to Multiversal tier which is immeasurably far stronger than Captain Marvel within the comics.

and this is not even factoring Rune King Thor who surpasses Odin.

The same Odin who can casually create Muitlversial shockwaves against Seth which can casually level galaxies and be felt across the entire Marvel Multiverse.

A Multiverse with at least 47,385,383 known dimensional realities going by the Marvel Database wiki which would be shaking 47 Million Universes at once with each of them having separate Mircoverses, Space timeline relates and too much to even count. That’s how powerful Odin is and Thor surpasses that.

Let’s do some Math for this one. One Universe is at least 93 Billion Light Year Long or roughly 870 Yottameters, that is 1×10^24 Meters wide with a mass of over 6×10^52 kg or 52 zeros and this is merely the size of the obsverable Universe.

www.space.com/24073-how-big-is…

Instead of taking one measurement method, a team of scientists led by Mihran Vardanyan at the University of Oxford did a statistical analysis of all of the results. By using Bayesian model averaging, which focuses on how likely a model is to be correct given the data, rather than asking how well the model itself fits the data. They found that the universe is at least 250 times larger than the observable universe, or at least 7 trillion light-years across.

Going by the Sicnfetic models, we got two sizes of the actual Universe size, 7 Trillion Light Years that can be used for the Low End and 23.25 Trillion Light Years as a high end.

Now let’s take into account the Roache Limit to separate the Universes. That’s between 25 to 30 times the length of the celestial object. So let’s go with the 25 times for Roach Limit.

This means that we got a High-End Distance between the Universes between 175 Trillion Light Years and 581.25 Trillion Light Years which is thousands of times the length of our Observable Universe.

To comprehend the sheer scale of this, i came up with a new term exclusive to determining Universe and Multiversal tier feats known as UniFoe.

vsbattles.fandom.com/wiki/User…

The real size of the Marvel Multiverse should be the size of the Multiverse in Multiverse theory.

The Multiverse is very huge. Our Local Multiverse has approximately 10^10^10^120 universes, although a multiverse can contain anywhere from only 2 universes to omega universes. Our universe lasts long, most of them only live for xonoseconds and pop. The diameter of the Local Multiverse is on the order of 92,200,000,000 * 10^10^10^120 light years across! A multiverse is a self-contained group or larger bubble filled with a finite or infinite number of universes. In many cases, the term is used to define a larger bubble filled with a finite or infinite number of universes. In many cases, the term is used to define the hypothetical set of every single possible universe, including the universe in which we live.

Now to sum up this mind-blowing number, the a real Mutivlerse is 9.3e+120,000 lightyears across, a mind-blowingly large size beyond comprehension.

www.space.com/34928-the-univer…

www.space.com/24073-how-big-is…

Let’s also assume the cubic size of the Universe for density and give each 92 Billion Lightyears the same density of our Universal plane. It should be well noted that current scinfetifc models believe that the Universe is flat meaning the Universe would be disk shaped like a galaxy.

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Milky_Wa…

The entire stellar disk of our galaxy is estimated to have a diameter of 100,000 light-years. The thickness of the Milky Way Galaxy is considered to be approximately 1,000 light-years.

Going by this formula, the size of our Universe should be 23.5 Trillion Light Years Wide and Long and having a thickness of at least 235 Billion Lightyears giving it the volume of 1.083314312985248e+88 m^3 or 1.14506413233621e+72 Cubic Lightyears

Contrast this with the Observable Universe which is 93 Billion Light Years in diameter and has a volume of 4×10^80 m^3 or 4.228008489853763e+64 Cubic Lightyears which is 27,082,879 timers smaller than the volume of the actual size of the Universe, you can fit roughly 27 Million Observable Universes inside the Diameter of the Actual Universe. That means the weight of the actual Universe is roughly 1.62×10^60 kg
